jdm.name: YouTube
jdm.notes: You can't delete your YouTube account without deleting your entire Google Account. But you can delete your channel.

points.title: Users are subject to Google's Privacy Policy

tosdr.tldr: When you use YouTube, you are subject to Google's policies. To find out more, see Google's latest terms of service on this app or read the full privacy policy on the Google site.
tosdr.case: your use is subject to a policies, guidelines, etc.

topics.name: Governance
topics.subtitle: Your relationship with the service and the community
topics.title: Governance

points.title: Your content can be removed without advance notice

tosdr.tldr: If your content violates the terms (in You Tube's opinion) they have a right to delete it and even terminate your account, without notice. This applies to cases of copyright infringement but also content that is pornographic, obscene or excessively long.
tosdr.case: they can delete specific files without prior notice and without a reason

topics.description: Your account and your data are on their servers, so they control them. Which guarantee do you have that lawful content and lawful activity will not be censored or suspended?
topics.name: Suspension and Censorship
topics.subtitle: Can they end your use of the service at any time?
topics.title: Suspension and Censorship

points.title: Very broad copyright license on your content

tosdr.tldr: The copyright licence is very broad. It includes the right for YouTube to share your content with others and to use in an unlimited way to promote the service in connection with its successors and affiliates (like Google). This licence is revoked when you delete your content but applies forever to textual content like comments.

topics.description: Copyright law gives you control over how your content (texts, photos, videos, etc.) can be used, by whom they can be distributed, modified, etc. Sometimes, online services need your permission to perform certain tasks with your content. That's why they ask you to grant them a copyright license. But sometimes, the copyright license is so broad, that your content can be exploited by others without asking you.
topics.name: Scope of the copyright license
topics.subtitle: Do you grant only the necessary rights?
topics.title: Scope of the copyright license

points.title: Submitting notices and counter notices for copyright infringement

tosdr.tldr: You can use the YouTube site to directly submit a take down notice if your copyright has been infringed. Similarly, the site supports the issuing of counter notices if these apply. See their copyright centre on the site for full details.
tosdr.case: help you deal with take-down notices

tosdr.tldr: Ordinarily, UK YouTube users are bound by English law for any legal matter arising from the Terms of Service. However, YouTube retains a right to apply for urgent legal remedies in any jurisdiction. Also, YouTube shares a universal privacy policy with Google and this policy relates to Google's terms which are governed by California laws and jurisdiction.
tosdr.case: court of law is in location X

topics.description: What is the jurisdiction, what laws govern the terms?
topics.name: Jurisdiction and governing laws
topics.subtitle: Where can you sue, or be sued, for breaching of the rules?
topics.title: Jurisdiction and governing laws

points.title: You are solely responsible for your account and its content

tosdr.tldr: You are solely responsible for your content and the consequences of its publication on YouTube together with all activity under your account. You are also solely responsible for keeping your account password secure. YouTube is not liable for any unauthorized use of your account, but you may be liable if this unauthorized use causes losses for YouTube or the others.
tosdr.case: you are responsible for what you publish

points.title: Terms may be changed at any time without advance notice

tosdr.tldr: The service can change the terms of service at any time, even without notification to the user. New or updated terms are posted on their site but your continued use of the service is taken as acceptance of the new or changed terms.

topics.description: Services need to evolve. But it is important that updating the service does not break the consentment with the user. Updates and changes to terms of service and privacy policy need to be properly noticed to users and to sollicit their agreement again.
topics.name: Notice of Changing Terms
topics.subtitle: Are users notified when terms change? Are they given enough time to find out what changed and discuss this with each other before deciding whether to continue to use the service under the new terms?
topics.title: Notice of Changing Terms

points.title: Deleted videos are not really deleted

tosdr.tldr: “Youtube may retain, but not display, distribute or perform, services copies of your content that you have removed or deleted. ”
tosdr.case: deleted content is not really deleted

topics.description: Once you subscribe to the service, will you have the right to leave it and remove your data?
topics.name: Right to leave the service
topics.subtitle: To avoid lock-in and stay in control
topics.title: Right to leave the service

points.title: Reduction of legal period for cause of action

tosdr.tldr: Any action against Youtube must begin within one year after the cause of action accrues. If not, the cause of the action is considered as permanently barred.
tosdr.case: reduction of legal period for cause of action
